data: The polar bear jumped out of the sea and snagged the Pomeranian from its perch.
No
No
This sentence does not contain any non-contemporaneous elements. It describes a plausible scenario involving a polar bear and a Pomeranian.
Johann Sebastian Bach wrote the book "Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy".
No
No
Bach was a composer, not a scientist. "Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy" was written by Isaac Newton.
Dr. Elizabeth Garrett Anderson lifted her hand from her dark colored moto jacket and traced the pharaoh's cartouche on the newly transported obelisk in the City of Westminster.
Yes
Yes
The mention of a moto jacket is an anachronistic element as this type of clothing did not exist during Dr. Elizabeth Garrett Anderson's time.
Eric the Red is credited with establishing the first permanent settlements in Greenland.
No
No
Eric the Red lived in the 10th century and established settlements in Greenland around the year 985, making it contemporaneous.
Charlamagne and the unrest under his rule is credited with the creation of Encarta, internet for the masses.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains anachronistic elements because Charlamagne ruled in the 8th-9th centuries, while Encarta and the internet were created much later.
Socrates was executed via lethal injection.
Yes
No
Socrates lived in ancient Greece, where lethal injection did not exist as a method of execution.
Prime Minister David Lloyd George said to his cabinet ministers: "I'm beginning to understand that World War I might be a more prolonged effort than we originally thought."
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements because David Lloyd George was not Prime Minister during World War I.
The brand new Mars rover used its solar panel to keep its batteries charged.
No
Yes
The mention of a "brand new Mars rover" is anachronistic as it implies a recent event involving technology not yet developed.
Albert Einstein wrote to Bertram Vivian Bowden about his showcased biomedical engineering notes published in Faster than Thought: A Symposium on Digital Computing Machines.
No
Yes
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Albert Einstein and digital computing machines did not coincide in time.
Squanto's role as a diplomat may have been essential in the provisions for the first Thanksgiving.
No
No
Squanto lived in the early 17th century, while the first Thanksgiving took place in 1621, making the statement contemporaneous.
The US senator used his vote to help pass the Wade-Davis bill.
No
Yes
The Wade-Davis bill was proposed during the Civil War, while the term "US senator" is a modern title.
Luciano Pavarotti wrote the opera "The Marriage of Figaro".
Yes
No
Pavarotti was a famous tenor, not a composer. "The Marriage of Figaro" was composed by Mozart in the 18th century.
Homo neanderthalensis consumed corn as a main staple of their diet.
Yes
No
Corn was domesticated in Mesoamerica around 9,000 years ago, long after Neanderthals went extinct around 40,000 years ago.
Homo Erectus, having survived as a species for millions of years, was known to wield scimitars against Smilodon.
Yes
Yes
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Homo Erectus and Smilodon did not coexist in the same time period.
Plato thought Hume was an absolute idiot.
Yes
Yes
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Plato and Hume lived in different time periods.
When scientists found the female Australopithecus afarensis, AL 288-1, they named her Lucy after the Beatles song.
No
Yes
The naming of Australopithecus afarensis after a Beatles song is anachronistic as the band came after the discovery.
George Washington Carver told Mahatama Gandhi to eat more soy to improve his nutrition.
No
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as George Washington Carver and Mahatma Gandhi lived in different time periods.
Jason, while exploring an ancient pyramid, opened a sealed box inside and found a floppy disk.
No
Yes
The mention of a floppy disk in an ancient pyramid setting is anachronistic, as floppy disks are modern technology.
The builders of the pyramids at Giza listened to music during their break.
No
Yes
The pyramids at Giza were built around 2500 BC, while the concept of music during work breaks is a modern idea.
The Mongolian horse rider used his bow to hunt the deer.
No
No
The sentence does not contain any non-contemporaneous elements. Mongolian horse riders historically used bows for hunting.
Pepin the Short's wife, Bertrada, played passionate piano pieces the night before marching into battle.
Yes
Yes
The mention of a piano in this context is anachronistic as pianos did not exist during Pepin the Short's time.
The first ever eggs Benedict was served to a cricket player.
No
Yes
This sentence contains a non-contemporaneous element as eggs Benedict was not created until the late 19th century.
Early hip hop was inspired by Cold War politics.
No
No
Hip hop emerged in the 1970s, after the Cold War era, so the statement contains non-contemporaneous elements.
Beats from the MPC3000 helped inspire many original blues artists.
Yes
No
The MPC3000 is a modern music production tool, not available during the time of original blues artists.
Homo neanderthalensis consumed meat as a main staple of their diet.
No
Yes
The term "Homo neanderthalensis" refers to an extinct species, making it non-contemporaneous with the present time.
Kurt Cobain starred in the 1980 television show "Twin Peaks".
Yes
No
Kurt Cobain was a musician in the 1990s, not an actor in the 1980s television show "Twin Peaks".
King Richard the Lionheart led the English armies in the Third Crusade.
No
Yes
The mention of King Richard the Lionheart and the Third Crusade indicates non-contemporaneous elements, as they are from the past.
The Hagia Sophia has seen drastic transformations to its interior from its inception, including becoming a church, a mosque, a museum, and back to a mosque again.
No
Yes
The sentence mentions the Hagia Sophia's transformation from a church to a mosque and back, which are non-contemporaneous elements.
McKenzie Scott and Bill Gates announced their divorce after 27 years of marriage.
No
No
The sentence does not contain non-contemporaneous elements as it describes a recent event involving two well-known individuals.
The first ever eggs Benedict was served to an ultimate frisbee player.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains an anachronistic element because ultimate frisbee was not invented until the 1960s, long after eggs Benedict.
Thomas Edison, Leonardo da Vinci, and Galileo Galilei, met in Geneva to envision the future of 5G wireless technology.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Thomas Edison, Leonardo da Vinci, and Galileo Galilei lived in different time periods.
Thomas Jefferson enjoyed honeycrisp apples on summer afternoons.
Yes
Yes
The mention of honeycrisp apples is anachronistic as they were not cultivated until the 1960s, long after Jefferson's time.
Pharoah Thutmose III successfully expanded the borders of the Egyptian empire through persistent military campaigns and improved military technology, such as spear tips made of jade.
No
No
The sentence does not contain non-contemporaneous elements. It describes events and technology that were plausible during Pharaoh Thutmose III's reign.
Catherine the Great waltzed with the Qianlong Emperor at Catherine Palace.
No
Yes
The mention of Catherine the Great and the Qianlong Emperor together is anachronistic as they lived in different time periods.
Bessie Smith's two favorite musicians were Ravi Shankar and Shakira.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Bessie Smith, Ravi Shankar, and Shakira did not live in the same time period.
The merchant traded some salt for a copy of his favorite book in the bustling city of Timbuktu, where Musa's glorious Madugu outshined all other buildings.
No
Yes
The mention of Timbuktu, Musa, and Madugu suggests a historical setting, potentially anachronistic with the mention of a favorite book.
President Syngman Rhee sent a letter commending Hugo Chavez's birthday.
No
No
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as President Syngman Rhee and Hugo Chavez were from different time periods.
Vasco de Gama avoided shipwreck by the Cape of Good Hope thanks to his astrolabe.
No
Yes
The astrolabe was not commonly used during Vasco de Gama's time for navigation, making it an anachronistic element.
Hannibal of Carthage would eventually pour gold down the throat of the richest man in Rome, Crassus the real estate mogul.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Hannibal and Crassus lived in different time periods and never interacted.

No
No
The sentence is anachronistic because Sun Tzu did not write about the failure of Babylon in "The Art of War."
Richard III used LEDs to light his throne room.
Yes
Yes
The use of LEDs in Richard III's time is anachronistic as they were not invented until the 20th century.

No
Yes
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Ivan the Terrible and Palestrina lived in different time periods.

Yes
No
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Genghis Khan lived in the 12th century and satellites were not invented until the 20th century.
Melinda and Bill Gates announced their divorce in 1805, after 270 years of marriage.
Yes
Yes
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as it mentions a divorce and marriage duration that are not possible in 1805.
President Woodrow Wilson rallied Americans to support the U.S. joining the League of Nations.
No
Yes
The League of Nations was established after World War I, making Woodrow Wilson's involvement non-contemporaneous.
Charles Babbage was a proficient Haskell programmer.
Yes
No
Charles Babbage lived in the 19th century, while Haskell programming language was developed in the late 20th century.
William Shakespeare collaborated with John Fletcher to write Two Noble Kinsmen.
No
No
Shakespeare and Fletcher did collaborate on Two Noble Kinsmen, written around 1613, so the elements are contemporaneous.

Yes
No
Hedy Lamarr lived in the early to mid 20th century, while Julia programming language was created in 2012.

Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Joan of Arc and American Ninja Warrior exist in different time periods.
Thomas Jefferson enjoyed watermelons on summer afternoons.
No
Yes
Watermelons were enjoyed by Thomas Jefferson, but the mention of summer afternoons is non-contemporaneous as it was not specified in historical records.
During their meetings in Bali, George Washington and the delegate of the Ashikaga shogunate exchanged gifts.
Yes
Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as George Washington and the Ashikaga shogunate did not exist at the same time.
The recognition of Christianity as the official religion of both Ethiopia and the Roman Empire within the same century is notable.
No
No
The sentence discusses events from different time periods (Ethiopia and Roman Empire), making it non-contemporaneous (anachronistic).

No
No
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Bruce Springsteen and Marie Antoinette lived in different time periods.
The Dodo was capable of hunting large herbivores like the Iguandodon.
Yes
Yes
The Dodo and the Iguanodon did not coexist, as the Dodo went extinct before the Iguanodon lived.

Yes
No
The American Civil War occurred in the 1860s, while George Washington lived in the 1700s.

Yes
Yes
The mention of a "nap pod" is anachronistic as this technology did not exist during Napoleon's time.

Yes
No
The sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements as Alexander Graham Bell and Alexander Hamilton lived in different time periods.

Yes
This sentence contains non-contemporaneous elements because Caesar Augustus was the first Roman emperor, not of the Holy Roman Empire.

No
Yes
The mention of the Stelliferous Era is anachronistic as it refers to a future era in cosmology, not the present.
